name: Denver

authority.name: Denver Parking Adjudication Office
authority.authority_name: City and County of Denver Parking Violations Bureau
authority.serves_description: Parking citations issued by the City and County of Denver (excluding park citations).

citation_pattern.notes: General parking citations in Denver usually list a numeric citation number and reference the Denver County Court.

appeal_address.missing_reason: Denver parking citations must be contested in person at Denver County Court; the official site does not provide a mailing address for Phase-1 appeals.

submission_methods.notes: To dispute a Denver parking citation you must schedule and attend a final hearing in person at Denver County Court within 20 days of issuance; there is no mail or online appeal option.

phone_confirmation.department: Denver County Court / Parking Violations Bureau
phone_confirmation.purpose: Confirm in-person hearing requirements and verify there is no mailing address for appealing Denver parking citations.

verification.source_note: Denver's Tickets and Disputes page states that to dispute a parking citation, you must schedule a final hearing in person at 1437 Bannock St., Room 135; there is no mail appeal option【837151970912746†L290-L317】.

official_confirmation_department: City and County of Denver / Parking Violations Bureau
official_confirmation_purpose: Confirm Phase-1 appeal mailing addresses and issuing authority routing.
qa_blocking_issues: City of Denver parking appeals require in-person hearings and no mailing address is provided; confirmation needed.
University of Denver, CU Denver, Auraria Campus, and Regis University sections lack mailing addresses and rely on online appeal forms; confirmation needed.
qa_known_gaps: Citation ID patterns for most authorities are based on limited information and have low confidence.
CU Denver, DU, Auraria Campus, and Regis University sections require follow-up to verify if any mail appeal addresses exist or if online-only appeals are correct.
